name: Nadia Tass
description: Comedic and cult classics take centre stage in Nadia Tass' career.

key_work.title: Spotlights: Nadia Tass
key_work.brief_description: A film director, producer and actress, originally from Florina, Macedonia, northern Greece, who moved to Australia in the 1960s. She began her career as an actress appearing in the television series Prisoner (1979–86) Her first feature film was the now iconic Malcolm (1986).

constellations_primary.name: Nadia Tass
constellations_primary.description: Comedic and cult classics take centre stage in Nadia Tass' career.

start.brief_description: A film director, producer and actress, originally from Florina, Macedonia, northern Greece, who moved to Australia in the 1960s. She began her career as an actress appearing in the television series Prisoner (1979–86) Her first feature film was the now iconic Malcolm (1986).

constellations_primary.name: Nadia Tass
constellations_primary.description: Comedic and cult classics take centre stage in Nadia Tass' career.

end.title: Malcolm
end.brief_description: Malcolm is a 1986 Australian cult film, written by David Parker and directed by Nadia Tass. The film stars Colin Friels as the titular tram enthusiast who becomes involved with petty crime. The film won the 1986 Australian Film Institute Award for Best Film.

constellations_other.name: Culture and identity on the Australian screen
constellations_other.description: Australian screen culture is distinctive, unexpected, playful and serious when it matters. Indigenous productions make a huge contribution to the unique identity of the Australian moving image.

constellations_other.name: Nadia Tass
constellations_other.description: Comedic and cult classics take centre stage in Nadia Tass' career.

links.description: Nadia Tass’ first feature film is the cult classic Australian comedy Malcolm, which she made with her husband David Parker. The film won the AFI Award for Best Film, along with seven other awards including Best Director and Best Script.

end.title: The Big Steal
end.creator_credit: Nadia Tass, David Parker, Timothy White and Cascade Films
end.brief_description: Danny (Ben Mendelsohn) wants two things in his life: a Jaguar car and a relationship with the beautiful Joanna (Claudia Karvan).

constellations_other.name: Nadia Tass
constellations_other.description: Comedic and cult classics take centre stage in Nadia Tass' career.

links.description: While Malcolm revolves around a tram enthusiast, transportation plays a key role in another Tass film, the Australian teen comedy The Big Steal. Featuring Ben Mendelsohn in his first starring role, it follows a young man trading in his family’s Nissan Cedric for a Jaguar.

start.title: The Big Steal
start.creator_credit: Nadia Tass, David Parker, Timothy White and Cascade Films
start.brief_description: Danny (Ben Mendelsohn) wants two things in his life: a Jaguar car and a relationship with the beautiful Joanna (Claudia Karvan).

end.title: Pure Luck
end.creator_credit: Nadia Tass, Grania Preston, Lance Hool, Sean Daniel, Sean Daniel Company, Silver Lion Films, Universal Pictures, Peter Wooley, Herschel Weingrod and Timothy Harris
end.brief_description: An accountant with super bad luck is sent in search of a missing boss’s daughter, also an incredibly unlucky.

constellations_other.name: Nadia Tass
constellations_other.description: Comedic and cult classics take centre stage in Nadia Tass' career.

links.description: After The Big Steal, and her two previous Australian comedies, Tass directed the American film Pure Luck, a vehicle for Martin Short about a clumsy, luckless man tasked with finding a similarly luckless woman who has been kidnapped.

start.title: Pure Luck
start.creator_credit: Nadia Tass, Grania Preston, Lance Hool, Sean Daniel, Sean Daniel Company, Silver Lion Films, Universal Pictures, Peter Wooley, Herschel Weingrod and Timothy Harris
start.brief_description: An accountant with super bad luck is sent in search of a missing boss’s daughter, also an incredibly unlucky.

constellations_other.name: Nadia Tass
constellations_other.description: Comedic and cult classics take centre stage in Nadia Tass' career.

end.title: Lethal Weapon
end.creator_credit: Richard Donner, Joel Silver and Warner Bros Pictures
end.brief_description: Mel Gibson stars as Martin Riggs, a loner cop with a tragic past which drives him to act with reckless disregard for his own safety.

constellations_other.name: Nadia Tass
constellations_other.description: Comedic and cult classics take centre stage in Nadia Tass' career.

links.description: Tass has since commented that the film is not “satisfying”, pointing out the differences in Australian and American humour, and that she and Short’s co-star, Danny Glover, wanted to do something different. Glover got his chance in another mismatched buddy movie with an Australian, Lethal Weapon with Mel Gibson.

end.title: The Simpsons
end.brief_description: Set in Springfield, the average American town, the show focuses on the antics and everyday adventures of the Simpson family; Homer, Marge, Bart, Lisa and Maggie, as well as a virtual cast of thousands. Since the beginning, the series has been a pop culture icon, attracting hundreds of celebrities to guest star. The show has also made name for itself in its fearless satirical take on politics, media and American life in general.

constellations_other.name: Migrations
constellations_other.description: Universal Everything's Migrations features fantastical creatures born from elements of other animals, just like the titles in this Constellation.

constellations_other.name: Oh, no! Beta!
constellations_other.description: The Sony Betacam BVP-3P was a broadcast-quality camera that used Sony's Beta system, most commonly found in consumer cameras. During the Format Wars in the 1970s and 80s, Beta lost to the cheaper and more accessible Video Home System (VHS).

constellations_other.name: Transformations
constellations_other.description: Like many techniques born from the visual language of magic lanterns, the dissolve effect was incorporated into filmmaking and is still used today.

constellations_other.name: Cartoon classics and criticism
constellations_other.description: A whole cavalcade of cartoons have successfully made the leap into arcades and onto consoles, but the relationship between cinema and videogames is far more likely to fizzle out.

constellations_other.name: Nadia Tass
constellations_other.description: Comedic and cult classics take centre stage in Nadia Tass' career.

links.description: The kidnapper in Pure Luck is Frank Grimes. If that name sounds familiar, it’s because of The Simpsons’ episode ‘Homer’s Enemy’, where a new employee to the power plant, Frank Grimes, suffers because of Homer’s carelessness and clumsiness, much like the Grimes in Pure Luck.

start.title: Spotlights: Nadia Tass
start.brief_description: A film director, producer and actress, originally from Florina, Macedonia, northern Greece, who moved to Australia in the 1960s. She began her career as an actress appearing in the television series Prisoner (1979–86) Her first feature film was the now iconic Malcolm (1986).

constellations_primary.name: Nadia Tass
constellations_primary.description: Comedic and cult classics take centre stage in Nadia Tass' career.

end.title: Prisoner
end.creator_credit: Marie Trevor and Reg Grundy Productions
end.brief_description: Created by Reg Watson and screening a total of 692 episodes between 1979 and 1986, “Prisoner” was one of the first television series to tackle issues such as rape, homosexuality and violence. It did this through the relationships between a cross section of women and the women who work around them at the Wentworth Detention Centre. This groundbreaking serial funded by the Grundy Organisation was screened in countries throughout the world and was remade in Germany and the U.K. The complete title of the series overseas was “Prisoner: Cell block H”. PLEASE NOTE: the dates recorded in entries pertain to copyright year and usually preceeds the screening year.

constellations_other.name: Nadia Tass
constellations_other.description: Comedic and cult classics take centre stage in Nadia Tass' career.

links.description: Before becoming an acclaimed director, Nadia Tass had a small role as Tessa Zervos in cult classic TV show Prisoner.

end.title: Forrest Gump
end.creator_credit: Charles Newirth, Steve Starkey, Steve Tisch, Wendy Finerman and The Steve Tisch Company
end.brief_description: Tom Hanks stars as one of the most memorable characters in cinematic history, Forrest Gump, the big-hearted man who was there in the biggest moments in American history. Directed by Robert Zemeckis and written by Eric Roth won six Academy Awards.

constellations_other.name: Quirky, eccentric, charming
constellations_other.description: The eponymous character of Malcolm (1986) is a kind and gentle young man obsessed with trams and making gadgets. Such charming and eccentric figures have a long lineage in screen history.

constellations_other.name: Dismissing the truth
constellations_other.description: The dismissal of Gough Whitlam by Governor-General Sir John Kerr is one of the most controversial moments in Australian politics. Whitlam’s rebuttal imploring the electorate to ‘maintain the rage’ was immortalised on TV and took on the gravitas of Shakespearean tragedy.

constellations_other.name: Nadia Tass
constellations_other.description: Comedic and cult classics take centre stage in Nadia Tass' career.

links.description: In Malcolm, Colin Friels’ portrayal suggests that Malcolm has high-functioning autism or Asperger syndrome. Another iconic character interpreted to have the same condition is Forrest Gump. David Parker has said he and Tass received the script for Forrest Gump but passed because “We’ve already done this.”
